body:
Comment 3 by **andrewdevplu**: 
Thank you for your quick reply. I will take a look at the HTML 5 spec and the package
source.

>I don't know about the termination condition,
though - for example does </script> end the
script if it is inside a Javascript comment or
string literal?

That is a very good point, so for the tokenizer to work properly, it will most likely
have to somewhat parse javascript, at least enough to understand comments and string
literals. This also brings up the problem of other script types, like VBScript and Tcl,
which I am guessing will cause the same problems.

I definitely understand why you moved this issue to long term...I do not know how
actively your team is working on this issue, but please let me know if you decide on
what direction you are moving in for a solution. I would like to know this because I
want to focus my own research in that direction. Thanks.
